questions.question: 1. What is the full form of ITC?
2. What do you mean by the term isothermal?
3. What are the major features of ITC?

answers.a: a process in which no heat is transferred into a system
answers.b: a process in which no heat is transferred into or out of a system
answers.c: a process in which no heat is transferred out of a system
answers.d: a process in which heat is transferred into or out of a system

questions.question: 8. Binding affinity is typically measured and reported by the equilibrium dissociation constant (KD), which is used to evaluate and rank order strengths of biomolecular interactions.

answers.a: The lower the KD value, the greater the binding affinity
answers.b: The lower the KD value, the lower the binding affinity
answers.c: The larger the KD value, the lower the binding affinity
